Because of different potentials, because a purpose is served, Because of fulfillment, and the absence of a first, the buddhas are not one; Yet, because there are no differences within the stainless abode, They are not many either. [X.77]
med pa gang yin de nyid ni/ / yod pa yi ni dam par 'dod/ / rnam pa kun du mi dmigs pa/ / dmigs pa yi ni mchog tu 'dod/ /
Nonexistence is itself Held to be perfectly existent. The complete absence of observation Is held to be the supreme observation. [X.78]
bsgom pa rnam par mi lta ba'i/ / bsgom pa dam par 'dod pa ste/ / thob par lta ba med rnams kyi/ / thob pa yang ni dam par 'dod/ /
The complete absence of the idea of meditation Is held to be the sublime meditation. The attainment of those who have no thought of attainment Is likewise held to be supreme. [X.79]
bla ma ring dang mtshan ma dang / / bdag gi brtson 'grus lhag lta ba'i/ / byang chub sems dpa' nga rgyal can/ / byang chub las ni ring zhes bya/ /
Arrogant bodhisattvas Who think of weight, length, and signs, And consider their own diligence special, Are said to be “far from enlightenment.” [X.80]
ji skad bshad pa de dag kun/ / rtog pa tsam du lta ba yi/ / byang chub sems dpa' rtog med rnams/ / byang chub thob ces nges par brjod/ /
It is definitively stated that bodhisattvas Who consider all that was taught to be mere thought, And who do not have any thought, Have attained enlightenment. [X.81]
klung dag sa yi 'og tu ma song ba/ / gnas rnams tha dad chu yang tha dad la/ / chu yang chung zhing bya ba tha dad byed/ / chu gnas srog chags phra mo'i nyer spyad 'gyur/ /

As long as rivers flow on the surface of the earth, They have different locations, and their waters are distinct. Containing but little water, they perform their own distinct functions, Providing for little water creatures. [X.82]
rgya mtshor song bar gyur na thams cad kyang / / gnas rnams gcig cing chu yang che la gcig / bya ba gcig cing chu la gnas pa yi/ / srog chags mang po'i rtag tu nyer spyad che/ /

Upon flowing into the ocean, they all Share one single location, and as one great water They perform the same function, Continuing to provide plentifully for numerous creatures living in water. [X.83]
sangs rgyas nyid du ma zhugs brtan pa rnams/ / rten kyang tha dad blo gros tha dad cing / / rtogs chung rang gi bya ba tha dad la/ / sems can nyung don rtag tu nyer spyad 'gyur/ /

Those steadfast ones who have not yet entered buddhahood Have distinct supports, and their intelligence differs. With little realization, they perform distinct activities, Constantly providing for but a few sentient beings. [X.84]
sangs rgyas nyid du zhugs na de dag kun/ / rten kyang gcig cing rtogs pa che la gcig / mdzad pa gcig tu 'dres shing rtag par yang / / sems can tshogs che'i nye bar spyad pa che/ /

Once they have entered buddhahood, they all Share a single support, and their vast realization is one. Their deeds merge as one, and they constantly provide plentifully For great multitudes of beings. [X.85]
de ltar sangs rgyas nyid ni dkar po'i chos/ / dpe med ldan phyir phan bde'i rgyu yi phyir/ / bde dge dam pa mi zad 'byung gnas phyir/ / blo ldan byang chub sems dge blang ba'i rigs/ /

In this way, since buddhahood possesses incomparably excellent qualities, Since it is the cause of benefit and happiness, And as it is an inexhaustible source of bliss and virtues of the most sublime kind, It is right for the wise to pursue the virtues of the enlightened mind. [X.86]
theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan las/ byang chub kyi le'u ste bcu pa'o// //
This was the tenth chapter of the Ornament of the Great Vehicle Sūtras, the chapter on enlightenment.
11. [mos pa'i le'u]
11. Summary of Chapters 1 through 10
sdom ni/ dang po sgrub skyabs rigs dang ni/ / de bzhin du ni sems bskyed dang / / rang gzhan don dang de nyid don/ / mthu dang yongs smin byang chub po/ /
Beginning, establishment, refuge, potential, Development of the mind, Benefit for self and others, reality, Power, full maturation, and enlightenment. [XI.1]
skyes dang ma skyes 'dzin dang gzung gyur dang / / grogs blangs bdag nyid dang ni nor pa dang / / ma nor mngon sum mngon sum ma yin gzhan/ / sgras byung tshol ba dang ni lta ba po/ /
'phrogs dang 'dres dang mi mthun phyogs ma 'dres/ / dman dang rgya che bsgribs dang ma bsgribs dang / / brtson dang mi brtson bsags dang ma bsags dang / / brtan zhugs ring du song ba'i mos pa'o/ /
yid la mi byed mang ba dang / / le lo rnal 'byor 'khrugs pa dang / / grogs ngan dge ba zhan pa dang / / tshul bzhin ma yin yid la byed/ /
Frequent failing to direct the mind, Laziness, disturbance to spiritual practice, Negative company, weakness of virtue, Improper mental activity, [XI.4]
bag med pa dang thos pa nyung / / thos dang bsam pa nyung ngus chog / zhi ba tsam gyis nga rgyal dang / / de bzhin ma 'dris yin par 'dod/ /
Carelessness, insufficient teaching, Contentment with one’s reception of teaching, and minor reflections, Pride based on mere peace, and lack of familiarity— These are asserted. [XI.5]
mi skyo ba dang de bzhin skyo/ / bsgribs pa dang ni mi brtson pa/ / tshogs ma bsags pa mos pa yis/ / bar du gcod par shes par bya/ /
Lack of disenchantment, disenchantment, Obscuration, lack of diligence, And not having gathered the accumulations— These are obstacles to inspiration. [XI.6]
bsod nams che dang 'gyod pa med/ / yid bde ba dang bde ba che/ / chud mi za dang brtan pa dang / / de bzhin khyad par 'gro ba dang / /
Vast merit, absence of regret, Mental bliss, great bliss, No dissipation, stability, Gaining distinction, [XI.7]
chos ni mngon par rtogs pa dang / / bdag dang gzhan don thob pa'i mchog / mngon shes myur ba de dag ni/ / mos pa yi ni phan yon yin/ /
Manifest realization of the Dharma, Supreme accomplishment of the welfare of self and others, And the agility of superknowledge— These are the benefits of inspiration. [XI.8]
'dod pa can gyi de khyi 'dra/ / ting nge 'dzin pa'i rus sbal bzhin/ / rang don byed pa'i de dran 'dra/ / gzhan don byed pa'i rgyal po bzhin/ /
In the desirous, it is like a dog, In meditative absorption, it resembles a turtle, In those who benefit themselves, it is like a slave, And in those who benefit others, it resembles a king. [XI.9]

ji ltar khyi ni rtag tu ltogs shing sdug bsngal gyis nyen chog mi shes/ / ji ltar rus sbal de ni chu yi nang na kun nas bskums shing 'dug / ji ltar bran ni rtag tu 'jigs shing skrag pa'i lus kyis rnam par rgyu/ / ji ltar rgyal po yang ni bka' yis yul la dbang sgyur gnas pa ltar/ /

It is like a dog that is always hungry, that suffers, and can never get enough, Like a turtle, completely withdrawn in the water, Like a slave who constantly moves with a frightened, fearful demeanor, And like a king who rules the land by decree. [XI.10]

de bzhin g.yem dang gnas dang rang gzhan phan bya don byed pa'i/ / mos pa sna tshogs dag gi rtag tu khyad par shes par bya/ / theg pa chen po de la de mchog tshul bzhin rig nas ni/ / 'di na brtan pas de la de nyid rtag par rab tu tshol/ /

Thus, the different inspirations of the frivolous, the introverted, Those who benefit themselves, and those who benefit others, should always be distinguished. Having properly seen that what pertains to the Great Vehicle is supreme, The steadfast should always pursue that to the highest degree. [X.11]
gang phyir sems can mir gyur pas/ / tshad med skad cig re re la/ / rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob de'i phyir/ / zhum pa dang du blang mi bya/ /
Beings of the human kind— Infinitely many, and in each and every instant— Attain complete enlightenment. Therefore, do not entertain dejection. [XI.12]
gzhan dag la ni zas sbyin pa'i/ / bsod nams 'phel ba ji lta bar/ / bdag nyid za ba'i ma yin pa/ / de bzhin gzhan don rten gyi chos/ /
When one feeds others, merit develops, Yet when one is eating, it does not. Likewise, by teaching the Dharma That supports the welfare of others, [XI.13]
bstan las mdo las gsungs pa yi/ / bsod nams cher 'byung thob pa ltar/ / rang gi don gyi rten gyi chos/ / bstan las thob pa ma yin no/ /
Great merit, just as taught in the sūtras, Will be attained. Yet that is not the case when the Dharma That supports one’s own welfare is taught. [XI.14]

de ltar 'phags pa chen po'i chos ni yangs gyur pa/ / blo dang ldan pas rtag tu mos pa cher bskyed na/ / bsod nams rgya chen rgyun mi 'chad dang de 'phel dang / / yon tan dpag tu med pas bdag nyid chen por 'gyur/ /

Hence, the Dharma of the great noble ones is extensive, And when the wise constantly develop strong inspiration, It creates unceasing great merit, enhancement, And unfathomable qualities, thereby turning them into great beings. [XI.15]
theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan las/ mos pa'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'o// //
This was the eleventh chapter of the Ornament of the Great Vehicle Sūtras, the chapter on inspiration.
12. [yongs su tshol ba'i le'u]
12. Inspiration
sde snod dag ni gsum mam gnyis kyang rung / / bsdus pa'i phyir te rgyu ni dgur 'dod do/ / des ni bag chags rtogs dang zhi ba dang / / rab tu rtogs pas rnam par grol bar byed/ /

There may be either three or two vessels, Yet, they are held for nine reasons in terms of what they contain. Through imprints, realization, pacification, and full realization, They bring about liberation. [XII.1]
mdo dang chos mngon 'dul ba dag / mdor na don ni rnam bzhir 'dod/ / blo dang ldan pas de shes nas/ / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa 'thob/ /
Sūtra, Abhidharma, and Vinaya Are held to be summarized in four topics. The wise gain complete omniscience By comprehending these topics. [XII.2]
gnas rnams dang ni mtshan nyid dang / / chos don smos phyir mdo yin no/ / mngon du'i phyir dang yang yang dang / / zil gnon rtogs phyir mngon pa'i chos/ /
Bases, characteristics, phenomena, and meanings— It is Sūtra because it proclaims these. In being oriented toward, persistent, overpowering, And eliciting realization, it is Abhidharma. [XII.3]
ltung dang 'byung dang ldang ba dang / / nges par 'byung dang gang zag dang / / bcas pa dang ni rab dbye dang / / rnam par nges phyir 'dul ba nyid/ /
The Vinaya is so called because it addresses downfalls, Occurrence, reemergence, and definitive emergence, As well as the person, formulation, Elaboration, and ascertainment. [XII.4]
dmigs pa chos dang nang dang ni/ / phyi dang gnyis ni yin par 'dod/ / don gnyis kyis ni gnyis po rnyed/ / gnyis po dag ni mi dmigs pas/ /
The focal points are held to be the Dharma, The inner, the outer, and both. Through the two realities, the two are discovered, And through the absence of a focal point in terms of the two. [XII.5]
yid kyi brjod pas bshad bzhin don/ / rab dang don du snang ba ni/ / brjod las yin par rab 'dzin phyir/ / sems ni ming la gnas pa'i phyir/ /

With respect to the meaning taught, the expression of mind becomes very bright, For it is clearly understood That whatsoever appears as meanings is due to expression, And the mind abides in names. [XII.6]
thos la sogs pa'i shes gsum gyis/ / chos kyi dmigs pa rnyed par 'gyur/ / dmigs pa rnam pa gsum rnyed pa/ / sngar bshad de la yang dag rten/ /

With the three cognitions that result from listening and the rest, The focal point of the Dharma is discovered. The discovery of the three focal points Depends entirely on what was just explained. [XII.7]
rigs gsum pa dang bya ba byed/ / gnod bcas gnod med rten can te/ / mos pa 'jog par byed dang gzhan/ / 'dun pa drag por byed pa dang / /
dman nad rdzogs rten rnam pa gnyis/ / rjod dang bcas dang rjod med nyid/ / shes pa dang ni mtshungs ldan pa/ / rnal 'byor rgyu dang bdag bcas dang / /
de ni 'dres la dmigs pa dang / / ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa ste/ / rnam pa lnga dang rnam bdun nyid/ / 'di yi yongs su shes pa lnga/ /
Observing integration And observing the distinct, Which are fivefold and sevenfold; Fivefold complete cognition; [XII.10]
rnam pa sgom dang ldan pa ni/ / bzhi dang sum cu rtsa bdun no/ / de ni lam gnyis rang bzhin te/ / phan yon gnyis dang nod pa dang / /
sbyor ba pa dang dbang sgyur dang / / chung dang rgya che'i bdag nyid de/ / rnal 'byor rnams kyi yid byed 'di/ / thams cad bdag nyid yin par 'dod/ /
Application; and mastery; The nature of the small and the vast— These ways that spiritual practitioners direct their minds Are held to constitute the nature of all. [XII.12]

rtag tu gnyis bral 'khrul pa'i rten gang yin dang gang zhig rnam kun du/ / brjod par nus ma yin zhing spros pa med pa'i bdag nyid de kho na/ / shes bya spang bya rang bzhin dri med 'dod gang rnam par sbyang bya ste/ / de ni nam mkha' gser dang chu ltar nyon mongs pa las rnam dag 'dod/ /

Always free from duality, the support for delusion, And the natural, entirely beyond expression and mental construction—such is reality. Considered what is to be understood, eliminated, and the stainless nature, this is to be purified. Like the sky, gold, and water, this is held to be pure, free from afflictions. [XII.13]

'gro ba dag na de las gzhan yang cung zad yod min la/ / 'gro ba ma lus pa yang de la kun du rmongs pa'i blo/ / yod pa kun nas spangs te med la mngon zhen gang yin pa/ / 'jig rten rmongs pa'i rnam pa tshabs chen 'di ko ji lta bu/ /

In wandering beings there is nothing but that, Yet in their delusion about this, all beings without exception Abandon the existent and become attached to the nonexistent. What is this dense delusion of the world?! [XII.14]
ji ltar sgyu ma de bzhin du/ / yang dag ma yin kun rtog brjod/ / sgyu ma'i rnam pa ji lta bar/ / de bzhin gnyis su 'khrul par brjod/ /
The false imagination is explained To be like a magical illusion. The delusion of duality is explained To be like the features of an illusion. [XII.15]
ji ltar de la de med pa/ / de bzhin du ni don dam 'dod/ / ji ltar de ni dmigs gyur pa/ / de bzhin du ni kun rdzob 'dod/ /
Just as those are not there, So the ultimate is asserted. Just as those are observed, So the relative is asserted. [XII.16]
de med na ni de yi rgyu/ / gsal bar dmigs pa ji lta ba/ / de bzhin gnas ni gzhan gyur na/ / yang dag ma yin rtog pa dmigs/ /
When that is not there, Its causes are clearly perceived. Likewise, upon fundamental transformation, The false imagination is perceived. [XII.17]
ji ltar 'jig rten ma 'khrul pa/ / de yi rgyu la 'dod dgur spyod/ / de bzhin sdom brtson ma 'khrul ba/ / gnas gzhan gyur la dgyes dgur spyod/ /

Just as mundane individuals, free from delusion, Act as they please with respect to its causes, So do those who persevere in the vows and are free from delusion Partake with delight in the fundamental transformation. [XII.18]
de yi rnam pa de la yod/ / de yi dngos po yod ma yin/ / de ltar sgyu ma la sogs la/ / yod dang med pa nyid du brjod/ /
There are such features there, Yet there are no such things. With regard to illusions and so forth, This is the way existence and nonexistence are explained. [XII.19]
de la yod pa med ma yin/ / med pa yod pa nyid ma yin/ / sgyu ma dag la sogs pa la/ / yod med khyad par med pa'ang brjod/ /
Within that, the present is not nonexistent, And the absent is not existent. With respect to illusions and the like, it is also explained That existence and nonexistence are not different. [XII.20]
de bzhin gnyis snang de la yod/ / de yi dngos po yod ma yin/ / de ltar gzugs la sogs pa la/ / yod dang med pa nyid du brjod/ /
Likewise, appearances of duality are there, But entities are not. Hence, with respect to form and so forth, There is both existence and nonexistence. [XII.21]
de la yod pa med ma yin/ / med pa yod pa nyid ma yin/ / gzugs la sogs pa dag la ni/ / yod med khyad par med pa'ang brjod/ /
Within that, the present is not nonexistent, And the absent is not existent. With respect to form and so forth, it is also explained That existence and nonexistence are not different. [XII.22]
sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa yi/ / mtha' rnams dgag par bya phyir dang / / theg pa dman pas 'gro ba dag / dgag par bya phyir 'dod pa yin/ /
Assertions are for the sake of negating The extremes of exaggeration and denigration And for the sake of preventing The journey by means of the Inferior Vehicle. [XII.23]
'khrul pa'i rgyu dang 'khrul pa ni/ / gzugs kyi rnam par rig pa dang / / gzugs can min rnam rig par 'dod/ / med phyir cig shos kyang med 'gyur/ /
The causes of delusion and delusion Are held to be awareness of form And awareness without form. When one does not exist, the other does not either. [XII.24]
sgyu ma'i glang po'i gzugs 'dzin pa/ / 'khrul phyir gnyis su brjod pa ste/ / de la ji bzhin gnyis med kyang / / gnyis po dag tu nye bar dmigs/ /
Apprehending the form of an illusory elephant Is a delusion with reference to which one speaks of duality. There is no actual duality there, And yet a duality is observed. [XII.25]
keng rus kyi ni gzugs 'dzin pa/ / 'khrul phyir gnyis su brjod pa ste/ / de la ji bzhin gnyis med kyang / / gnyis po dag tu nye bar dmigs/ /
Apprehending the form of a skeleton Is a delusion with reference to which one speaks of duality. There is no actual duality there, And yet a duality is observed. [XII.26]
'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid chos gang yin/ / de bzhin yod dang de bzhin med/ / yod med khyad par med pa'i phyir/ / yod dang med dang sgyu ma 'dra/ /

The phenomena that characterize delusion Are, in that same way, existent and nonexistent. Because existence and nonexistence are thus not different, Existence and nonexistence are like an illusion. [XII.27]
gnyen po'i chos ni gang yin pa/ / de bzhin med dang de bzhin yod/ / de bzhin med phyir mtshan nyid med/ / sgyu ma dang yang 'dra bar bstan/ /
The phenomena that constitute the remedy Are, in that same way, not existent, existent, and not existent. Therefore, the characteristics are taught To be nonexistent and like an illusion. [XII.28]
sgyu ma'i rgyal po sgyu ma yi/ / rgyal po gzhan gyis pham pa ltar/ / gang dag gis ni chos mthong ba'i/ / rgyal sras de dag nga rgyal med/ /
An illusory king may be defeated By another illusory king. In that way, those children of the victorious ones Who see phenomena have no pride. [XII.29]

sangs rgyas rnams sangs rgyas mchog rnams kyis de dang de las 'dus byas dag / gsungs pa sgyu ma rmi lam smig rgyu gzugs brnyan dang 'dra mig yor dang / / brag ca lta bu dang ni chu zla'i gzugs 'dra sprul dang 'drar shes bya/ / drug dang drug dang gnyis dang drug tshan gnyis dang gsum po re rer 'dod/ /

The supreme and perfectly awakened buddhas teach again and again That conditioned things should be understood to resemble illusions, dreams, mirages, reflections, Optical illusions, echoes, the moon’s reflections in water, and emanations. Respectively, these are asserted with reference to the six, the six, the two, the six, the two sets of six, and the three. [XII.30]
yang dag min rtog yang dag min/ / yang dag ma yin min mi rtog / rtog min mi rtog ma yin pa/ / shes bya thams cad yin par brjod/ /
False imagination, neither correct Nor false, not conceptual, Not conceptual and not nonconceptual— This characterizes all objects of cognition. [XII.31]
rang gi khams las gnyis snang zhing / / ma rig nyon mongs lhan cig tu/ / 'jug pa'i rnam rtog rab 'byung ste/ / rdzas gnyis rnam par spangs pa yin/ /
The two appear from their own element, And, together with ignorance and affliction, Engaged thoughts emerge While being devoid of dual substance. [XII.32]
dmigs pa'i khyad par thob pa yi/ / rang gi dbyings la gnas ldan phyir/ / de nyid gnyis su snang med par/ / 'jug ste lpags dang mda' bzhin no/ /

Upon the attainment of the special focal point, There is abidance and possession within their own natural element. Hence, there is engagement with the reality free from dualistic appearance, As in the case of the hide and the arrow. [XII.33]
sems ni gnyis su snang ba ste/ / de bzhin chags sogs snang ba 'am/ / dad la sogs par snang bar 'dod/ / nyon mongs dge chos yod ma yin/ /
It is held that the mind appears as duality, And that it likewise appears as attachment and so forth, As well as faith and so forth. No afflictions or virtuous qualities exist. [XII.34]
sems ni sna tshogs snang ba dang / / rnam pa sna tshogs can du 'jug / de la snang de yod dang med/ / de phyir chos kyi ma yin no/ /
Mind appears as diversity And is active with various features. Since it appears in this way there is existence and yet none. Hence this is not related to things. [XII.35]
sangs rgyas rnams kyis sems can la/ / phan gdags phyir ni mtshan gzhi dang / / mtshan nyid dang ni mtshon pa dag / rab tu dbye bas yang dag bshad/ /
For the benefit of sentient beings, The buddhas teach By distinguishing bearers of characteristics, Characteristics, and that which is characterized. [XII.36]
sems ni lta bcas gang yin dang / / de yi gnas skabs mi 'gyur ba/ / 'di ni mdor na mtshan gzhi ste/ / rab tu dbye na tshad med do/ /
The mind, along with its views, Its contexts, and the unchanging Are, in short, the bearers of the characteristics. When discerned, they are limitless. [XII.37]
ji ltar brjod don 'du shes kyi/ / rgyu mtshan dang de'i bag chags dang / / de las kyang don snang ba ni/ / kun brtags pa yi mtshan nyid do/ /

The reasons conceived of as objects that accord with expressions, The habitual tendencies associated with those, And the appearances of objects based on those: These are characteristics of the imaginary. [XII.38]
ming dang don ni ji lta bar/ / don dang ming du snang ba gang / / yang dag min rtog rgyu mtshan ni/ / kun brtags pa yi mtshan nyid do/ /
That which appears as object and name In accordance with name and object, And serves as the reason for false imagination: This is the characteristic of the imaginary. [XII.39]
rnam gsum rnam gsum snang ba can/ / 'dzin dang gzung ba'i mtshan nyid de/ / yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni/ / gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid de/ /
Having the three and the three appearances, The characteristics of the apprehended and the apprehender, This false imagination Is the characteristic of the dependent. [XII.40]
med dang yod nyid gang yin dang / / yod dang med pa mnyam nyid dang / / ma zhi zhi dang rnam mi rtog / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do/ /
Nonexistence and existence, The sameness of existence and nonexistence, No peace, peace, and nonthought Are the characteristics of the thoroughly established. [XII.41]
rgyu mthun chos la dmigs nas ni/ / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / / sems kyi dbyings la gnas pa dang / / don yod pa dang med par mthong / /
Based on the focal point of the Dharma of causal concordance, The mind is directed correctly, Abides in the field of the mind, And sees how the object is existent and nonexistent. [XII.42]
de na mnyam pa nyid du 'gyur/ / 'phags rigs shin tu dri med pa/ / mnyam dang khyad 'phags 'bri med cing / / 'phel ba med pa'i mtshan nyid do/ /
Within that, one is perfectly equal. The noble potential is utterly stainless. Equal, superior, without decrease, and without increase— These are its characteristics [XII.43]
sa bon gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir/ / gnas don lus su snang ba dag / gzhan du gyur pas zag med dbyings/ / de ni rten kun 'gro ba can/ /
Because the seeds have been transformed, The appearances of abode, object, and body Have turned into something else: The undefiled field, the omnipresent basis. [XII.44]
yid dang 'dzin dang rnam par rtog / gyur phyir rnam par mi rtog dang / / zhing dang ye shes las dag la/ / dbang ni rnam pa bzhi yin no/ /
Mental cognition, apprehensions, and thought— Because these have changed, There is a fourfold mastery of nonconceptuality, The fields, wakefulness, and activity. [XII.45]
dbang de mi g.yo la sogs pa'i/ / sa gsum la ni rnam bzhi ste/ / gcig la rnam gnyis de las gzhan/ / dbang re rer ni 'dod pa yin/ /
There are four masteries Upon three grounds, beginning with the Immovable. One contains two masteries, And the others one each. [XII.46]

blo dang ldan pas srid rtogs bdag med rnam pa gnyi ka'ang rig 'gyur la/ / de yang mnyam par shes nas de ni 'dzin pa'i sgo nas de nyid 'jug / de nas de la yid gnas phyir na de la de yang mi snang ngo / / de ni snang ba grol ba yin te mchog tu dmigs dang bral ba'o/ /

The wise also become aware of the twofold absence of self throughout existence. With equal understanding, they access reality through apprehension. Then, because their minds abide there, not even that appears. This nonappearance is liberation, supremely free from focal points. [XII.47]
tshogs kyi gzhi dang bskyed yod na/ / ming tsam du ni mthong bar 'gyur/ / ming tsam mthong ste der mthong nas/ / de yang phyi nas mi mthong ngo / /
When through accumulation there is a basis and development, Perception takes place in terms of names only. One only sees names and so, by that perception, One will later not see that either. [XII.48]
sems ni gnas ngan len dang bcas/ / bdag lta'i zhags pas zin par ni/ / rab tu 'jug par 'gyur te de/ / nang du gnas phyir ldog par 'dod/ /
Mind, possessing negative tendencies, Is held by the shackles of belief in a self. Thus, it is thoroughly engaged, Yet due to inner abiding, it is held to turn back. [XII.49]
rang dang rang gi bdag nyid du/ / med phyir rang gi ngo bo la/ / mi gnas phyir dang bzung bzhin de/ / med phyir ngo bo nyid med 'dod/ /
snga ma phyi ma'i rten yin pas/ / ngo bo nyid ni med pa yis/ / skye med 'gag med gzod nas zhi/ / rang bzhin mya ngan 'das pa 'grub/ /

The former are the supports of the latter. Hence, with reference to the absence of essential nature, Absence of arising, absence of cessation, peace from the beginning, And the natural transcendence of suffering—are all established. [XII.51]
thog ma dang ni de nyid gzhan nyid dang / / rang gi mtshan nyid rang dang gzhan du 'gyur/ / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang khyad par la/ / skye ba med pa'i chos la bzod par bshad/ /
Beginning, self, other, Own characteristics, self, change, Thorough affliction, and the distinct— This is how the acceptance of nonarising phenomena is explained. [XII.52]
chos dang bdag med grol ba rnams/ / mtshungs phyir rigs ni tha dad phyir/ / bsam gnyis thob phyir sprul pa'i phyir/ / mthar thug phyir ni theg gcig nyid/ /
kha cig dag ni drang phyir dang / / gzhan dag yang dag gzung ba'i phyir/ / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni/ / ma nges rnams la theg gcig bshad/ /
In order to lead some And to sustain others, The perfect buddhas teach those uncertain That the vehicles are one. [XII.54]
nyan thos ma nges rnam gnyis te/ / theg don mthong dang ma mthong ba'o/ / don mthong 'dod chags bral ba dang / / 'dod chags bral min 'di dman pa'o/ /

Uncertain listeners are of two kinds For some have seen the objective of that vehicle, while others have not. Of those who have seen it, some are free And some are not free from desire—these are inferior. [XII.55]
de gnyis 'phags pa'i lam thob pa/ / srid pa dag tu sgyur ba'i phyir/ / bsam gyis mi khyab sgyur ba yi/ / skye ba dang ni yang dag ldan/ /
Since the two who have attained the path Of the noble ones take up existences, They are in possession Of inconceivable birth. [XII.56]
gcig ni smon lam dbang gis na/ / skye ba rab tu sgrub par byed/ / cig shos phyir mi 'ong ba dang / / ldan phyir sprul pas rab tu sgrub/ /
Some thoroughly accomplish birth By the power of their aspirations. Others thoroughly accomplish by means of emanations Because they possess nonreturn. [XII.57]
de gnyis yang dang yang du ni/ / rang sems kun du 'byung ldan pas/ / mya ngan 'das la mngon dga'i phyir/ / rtogs pa bul ba yin par 'dod/ /
Since, for the two, the selfish mind Repeatedly emerges, They are fond of transcendence And are therefore held to be slow realizers. [XII.58]
don byas ma yin de sangs rgyas/ / med par skyes nas sprul don gnyer/ / bsam gtan don brtson der brten nas/ / byang chub dam pa 'thob par 'gyur/ /
Those who have not accomplished the objective are born When there is no buddha and pursue emanation. They apply themselves to concentration And, on that basis, attain true enlightenment. [XII.59]

rig pa'i gnas lnga dag la brtson par ma byas na/ / 'phags mchog gis kyang thams cad mkhyen nyid mi 'gyur te/ / de lta bas na gzhan dag tshar bcad rjes gzung dang / / bdag nyid kun shes bya phyir de la de brtson byed/ /

Unless they pursue the five fields of knowledge, Even supreme noble beings will not become omniscient. They therefore apply themselves to these so that they may conquer and provide for others, And so that they themselves will know everything. [XII.60]
rgyu dmigs nas ni dga' ba dang / / rten la de rjes dran pa dang / / 'bras bu thun mong 'dod pa dang / / ji ltar byang chub bzhin mos pa'o/ /
There is joy through the observation of the cause, Recollecting the support, Wishing for the universal fruition, And aspiring in perfect accordance with enlightenment. [XII.61]
mthu ni rnam pa bzhi dag gis/ / dka' dang nges par mi skyo dang / / mi mthun phyogs dang gnyen po la/ / sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi yin no/ /
Because of the four powers, there is joy, Definitive absence of weariness, And the four practices associated With conflicting factors and remedies. [XII.62]
rab dang yang dag nod pa dang / / gzhan la sbyin par 'dun pa dang / / go cha dang ni smon lam dang / / mngon par dga' dang bya ba'i yid/ /
There is inspiration, true reception, The intention to be generous to others, Armor, aspiration prayer, Manifest joy, and creative mind. [XII.63]
sbyin sogs rnam pa drug la ni/ / mthu thob pa dang yongs smin dang / / mchod pa dang ni sten pa la/ / yang dag spro ba mchog dang brtse/ /
With respect to generosity and the rest of the six, There is attainment of power, maturation, worship, and reliance. In these there is supreme and true delight. There is also love. [XII.64]
ma byas ngan par byas pa la/ / ngo tsha 'gyod dang yul la dga'/ / skyo la dgra bo'i 'du shes dang / / 'gong dang brjod pa'i blo gros so/ /

About that which was not done or poorly done, There is shame and regret. There is joy in the objective and weariness is considered the enemy. There is establishment and intelligence of expression. [XII.65]
sbyin sogs rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi/ / rten yin dbang phyug la sogs min/ / gnyis po dag la skyon dang ni/ / yon tan so so yang dag rig /
Generosity and so forth are the support for complete enlightenment; Not the Almighty or the like. With respect to the two, There is correct awareness in terms of flaws and good qualities. [XII.66]
bsags pa rjes su dran pa yis/ / dga' dang don chen mthong ba dang / / rnal 'byor rnam par mi rtog dang / / de 'dzin byed dang phrad 'dod pa/ /
log par 'dzin pa rnam pa bdun/ / spong ba'i mthu ni thob pa dang / / ngo mtshar ngo mtshar med pa la/ / 'du shes rnam pa bzhi nyid do/ /
There is the attainment of the power Of relinquishing the seven mistaken ways of apprehending. There are the four notions Of the amazing and the unamazing. [XII.68]
sems can rnams la snyoms pa dang / / bdag nyid chen po mthong ba dang / / gzhan gyi yon tan lan re dang / / gsum du smon dang rgyun du'o/ /
There is equanimity toward sentient beings, Perception of the great being, Hoping for the reward of others’ qualities, Wishing for the three, and continuity. [XII.69]
sangs rgyas bstan pa bsgrub pa'i phyir/ / tshu rol mi gnas sems pa dang / / des sman dar ba'i sems can la/ / mi dga' ba dang rab dga' ba'o/ /

Because of practicing in accordance with the Buddha’s teaching, The mind does not dwell on this side. Hence, regarding beings who are inferior and who flourish, There is displeasure and delight. [XII.70]
bsgom pa bcos dang yang dag la/ / ma dad pa dang dad pa dang / / dang du mi len yid byed dang / / lung bstan nges par dga' ba'o/ /
Regarding artificial and authentic training, There is absence of faith and faith. The mind is directed without acceptance, And there is joy in the prophecy and the certainty. [XII.71]
phyi ma'i tshe la mthong ba'i phyir/ / 'jug sems mnyam par blta ba'i phyir/ / mchog chos rnams la zhugs pa yis/ / bdag nyid mchog tu nges 'dzin phyir/ /
There is seeing of future lives, Intent on engagement, regarding as equal, And, because of having accessed the supreme qualities, Ascertainment of oneself as supreme. [XII.72]
pha rol phyin bcu'i rgyus byung ba/ / dge ba yid la byed 'di dag / rtag tu byang chub sems dpa' yi/ / khams ni rtas par byed pa yin/ /
These ways of directing the mind Toward virtues caused by the ten transcendences Bring forth a constant development Of the bodhisattva element. [XII.73]
rgyas dang lhag pa'i bsam dang chen po ni/ / brten pa'i yongs su tshol ba yin par 'dod/ / de dag gi ni spang dang bcas pa dang / / spang bya med dang de bzhin dbang 'byor pa'o/ /
Expansion, superior intent, and greatness Are held to be the investigations of the steadfast ones. These involve discards, Involve no discards, and, likewise, mastery. [XII.74]
byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshol ba ni/ / sku med pa dang sku bcas sku thob dang / / sku yongs rdzogs dang nga rgyal mang ba dang / / nga rgyal phra dang nga rgyal med par 'dod/ /

The investigations of the bodhisattvas Are held to be lacking body, in possession of body, The attainment of body, the completion of body, Frequent pride, subtle pride, and the absence of pride. [XII.75]
brtan chos gzugs dang gzugs min la/ / mtshan dang de bzhin nad med dang / / mngon shes rnams kyi dbang phyug dang / / de zad mi shes nyid kyi rgyu/ /
The steadfast ones’ Dharma is, in terms of form and the formless, The cause of marks, the absence of disease, The mastery of superknowledges And inexhaustibility. [XII.76]

rgyal ba'i sras rnams kyis ni yod dang med pa dang / / sgro 'dogs skur ba'i rtog dang gcig dang du ma nyid/ / rang dang khyad par rtog dang ming don ji bzhin du/ / mngon par zhen pa'i rtog pa yang dag spang bar bya/ /

Existence, nonexistence, exaggeration, denigration, Oneness, multiplicity, nature, distinction, And the attachment to name and entity as such— These thoughts are to be abandoned by the children of the victorious ones. [XII.77]

de ltar blo gros dge ba brtson 'grus drag rten nas/ / de bzhin nyid bcas gnyis kyi chos nyid yongs btsal ba/ / de phyir rtag tu skye dgu rnams kyi ston par 'gyur/ / de ni rgya mtsho bzhin du yon tan rnams kyis gang / /

Thus, the virtuous intelligence, with intense diligence, Investigates the twofold intrinsic nature, including suchness, And manifests, therefore, always as the teacher of beings, Like an ocean full of excellent qualities. [XII.78]
theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan las/ yongs su tshol ba'i le'u ste bcu gnyis pa'o// //
This was the twelfth chapter of the Ornament of the Great Vehicle Sūtras, the chapter on the investigation of the Dharma.
13. [bshad pa'i le'u]
13. Teaching

brtan pa rnams ni srog dang longs spyod tshegs ches rnyed cing snying po med pa dag / rab dga'i yid kyis sems can sdug bsngal rnams la sbyin rnams rgya chen rtag gtong na/ / chos yangs skye dgu rnams la rnam pa kun du phan byed tshegs ches rnyed min zhing / / shin tu btang yang zad med 'phel 'gyur ba lta lan cig ma yin smos ci dgos/ /

The lives of the steadfast ones and their enjoyments, acquired with great hardship and yet futile, Are always, most happily and in full, passed on to suffering beings. What need then is there to speak of the expansive Dharma, that constant source of benefit, Which is not obtained with hardship, and which, when given, is not depleted but enriched? [XIII.1]

gang phyir so so rang rig bya phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis chos ma bstan/ / thugs rje'i bdag nyid sprul chen lta bus rigs bshad dbugs 'dra'i chos rnams kyis/ / skye bo nyid kyi chos la kun nas drangs te nyer zhi zhal gyi sgo/ / rnam par dag pa rgya chen thun mong zad mi shes la yang dag bkod/ /

As it is the object of individual awareness, the Blessed One did not teach the Dharma. The embodiment of compassion, like the giant snake, by means of the reasoned exposition of the breath-like Dharma, Draws beings to his own Dharma and establishes them truly within The pure, vast, universal, and inexhaustible mouth of perfect peace. [XIII.2]

de ltas rnal 'byor can gyi sgom pa gang yin de ni don med min/ / de ltar bde bar gshegs kyi bstan pa gang yin de yang don med min/ / gal te thos pa tsam gyis don mthong 'gyur na sgom pa don med 'gyur/ / gal te ma thos par yang bsgom 'jug 'gyur na bstan pa don med 'gyur/ /
sems dpa' mchog gi ston pa ni/ / lung dang rtogs dang dbang 'byor las/ / kha dang gzugs ni thams cad dang / / nam mkha' las kyang 'byung ba yin/ /
The teaching of a supreme heroic being Comes from scripture, realization, and mastery. Emerging from the mouth and all sorts of form, It even arises from space. [XIII.4]
rgya che the tshom spong ba dang / / gzung 'os de nyid gnyis ston pa/ / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' yi/ / ston pa phun tshogs yin zhes bya/ /
A teaching that is vast, free from doubt, Trustworthy, and reveals the twofold reality— This is what is known As the bodhisattva’s excellent teaching. [XIII.5]
sems dpa' mchog gi ston pa ni/ / 'jam zhing rgyags bral mi skyo dang / / gsal zhing sna tshogs rigs pa dang / / go zhing zang zing med kun 'gro/ /
The teaching of the supreme bodhisattva Is gentle, free from conceit, untiring, Clear, diverse, reasoned, Comprehensible, unconcerned with material things, and universal. [XIII.6]
rgyal sras tshig ni mi zhen pa/ / snyan cing legs bshad grags pa dang / / ci rigs pa dang zang zing med/ / ran cing de bzhin yangs pa yin/ /
The words of the child of the victorious ones are not subdued, But delightful, well spoken, established, Appropriate, without concern for material things, Proportionate, and far reaching. [XIII.7]
bstan dang de bzhin bshad pa dang / / theg dang mthun dang bde ba dang / / grags pa dang ni ci rigs dang / / nges par 'byung dang mthun pa'i phyir/ /
Teaching, explanation, Accordance with the vehicles, delight, Acceptance, appropriateness, Definitive emergence, and accordance—[XIII.8]
de mdor sems dpa' mchog rnams kyi/ / yi ge phun tshogs yin zhes bya/ /
In short, such are The excellent letters of the supreme bodhisattvas. [XIII.9a–b]
bde gshegs gsungs ni mtha' yas te/ / yan lag drug cu bsam mi khyab/ /
The speech of the Bliss-Gone One is infinite, Consisting of the inconceivable sixty qualities. [XIII.9c-d]
ngag tshig shin tu rigs pa dang / / brten dang rnam 'byed the tshom gcod/ / lan mang byed dang ldan pa ni/ / mgo smos rnam spros go rnams la/ /
Speech and words that are extremely reasonable, Presenting, distinguishing, and cutting through doubt, With many repetitions for those who understand By indication and through elaboration, [XIII.10]
sangs rgyas rnams kyi ston pa 'di/ / 'khor gsum gyis ni dag pa ste/ / 'di ni nyes pa brgyad dag dang / / bral ba nyid du shes par bya/ /
This teaching of the buddhas Is beyond the three spheres. Moreover, it should be known to be Free from the eight defects. [XIII.11]
le lo dang ni mi go ba/ / skabs mi 'byed dang ma nges dang / / the tshom dag ni mi gcod dang / / de dang bral bar brten mi byed/ /
Laziness, incomprehensibility, Failing to take an opportunity, uncertainty, Failing to cut through doubts, Failing to do so in a lasting way, [XIII.12]
skyo ba dang ni ser sna nyid/ / 'di dag gtam gyis nyes par 'dod/ / de dag med phyir sangs rgyas kyi/ / bshad pa bla na med par 'gyur/ /
Weariness, and stinginess— These are held to be defects of discourse. Because it is free of those, The teaching of the Buddha is unsurpassable. [XIII.13]
dad dang dga' dang blo rnams kyi/ / rgyu phyir chos 'di dge ba yin/ / don rnam gnyis ldan gzung bla dang / / yon tan gzhi can tshangs spyod ston/ /

Faith, joy, and intelligence—since it causes these, This Dharma is virtuous. Endowed with the twofold meaning, it is easy to comprehend, And it teaches a pure conduct that possesses four qualities. [XIII.14]
gzhan dag thun mong ma yin ldan pa dang / / khams gsum nyon mongs rnam spong rdzogs byed dang / / ngo bo nyid dag dri mas dag pa ste/ / tshangs spyod yon tan bzhi ldan yin par 'dod/ /

Possession of that which is not shared by others, Complete elimination of the afflictions of the three realms, Essential purity, and purity in the absence of stains— Thus it is held to be a pure conduct that possesses four qualities. [XIII.15]
gzhug pa ldem por dgongs pa dang / / mtshan nyid ldem por dgongs pa dang / / gnyen po ldem por dgongs pa dang / / bsgyur ba ldem por dgongs pa ste/ /
Concealed intent on access, Concealed intent on characteristics, Concealed intent on remedies, And concealed intent on change—[XIII.16]
nyan thos dang ni ngo bo nyid/ / de bzhin nyes pa 'dul ba dang / / brjod pa zab pa nyid la ni/ / ldem por dgongs pa 'di rnam bzhi/ /
Thus, relating to the listeners, the essential nature, The overcoming of flaws, And the profundity of expression, The concealed intent is fourfold. [XIII.17]
mnyam pa nyid dang don gzhan dang / / de bzhin du ni dus gzhan dang / / gang zag gi ni bsam pa la/ / dgongs pa rnam pa bzhir shes bya/ /
Equality, another meaning, Another time, And individual inclinations— This is known as the fourfold intent. [XIII.18]
sangs rgyas chos la brnyas pa dang / / le lo cung zad chog 'dzin dang / / nga rgyal 'dod chags spyod pa dang / / 'gyod dang ma nges ldog pa ni/ /
Disdain for the Buddha and the Dharma, Laziness, contentment with the insignificant, Pride, engagement with desire, Regret, and return of those uncertain—[XIII.19]
sems can rnams kyi sgrib pa ste/ / de yi gnyen por theg mchog gsungs/ / des de'i bar du gcod pa yi/ / nyes pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur/ /
These are obscurations of sentient beings, And the supreme vehicle is taught as their remedy. Thereby, all of the obstructing Flaws will be overcome. [XIII.20]
gang zhig tshig gam don sgo nas/ / tshigs bcad gnyis 'dzin rab sbyor ba/ / sems can blo ldan mchog de yis/ / yon tan rnam bcu thob 'gyur te/ /
Whoever, in word or meaning, upholds And applies himself or herself to these two stanzas Is a supremely intelligent being Who will attain ten different qualities: [XIII.21]
khams ni zad par rtas pa dang / / 'chi ba'i tshe na rab dga' mchog / ji ltar 'dod par skye ba dang / / kun du tshe rabs dran pa dang / /
Exhaustive development of the element, Supreme joy at the time of death, Birth in accordance with his or her wishes, Perfect recall of previous lives, [XIII.22]
sangs rgyas rnams dang 'phrad pa dang / / de las theg mchog thos pa dang / / mos pa blo dang bcas pa dang / / sgo gnyis byang chub myur thob pa'o/ /
Meeting with buddhas, Hearing the supreme vehicle from them, Devotion endowed with intelligence, The two gateways, and swift attainment of enlightenment. [XIII.23]

de ltar blo bzang skyo ba med ldan brtse ba can/ / snyan pa rab grags cho ga bzang shes ldan pa yi/ / byang chub sems dpa' legs par smra ba yin pa ste/ / bshad pas skye bo'i nang na nyi ma bzhin du lham/ /

Thus, with excellent intelligence, free from weariness, and loving, In high esteem, and aware of the excellent means, The Bodhisattva teaches well. Explaining among the people, they shine like the sun. [XIII.24]
theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan las/ bshad pa'i le'u ste bcu gsum pa'o// //
This was the thirteenth chapter of the Ornament of Great Vehicle Sūtras, the chapter on teaching.
14. [sgrub pa'i le'u]
14. Practice
blo ldan gnyis la log nyid dang / / yang dag nyid rnam spangs gsum gyis/ / gang zag dang ni chos dag la/ / bdag med rnam gnyis kun shes nas/ /
Regarding the two, the wise, by means of three That are not mistaken and are not correct, Thoroughly understand the twofold absence of self With respect to persons and phenomena. [XIV.1]
don shes pa ni chos rnams kun/ / gzings dang 'dra ba nyid du rig / thos pas chog par 'dzin spong ba/ / des na chos shes pa zhes brjod/ /

Then, understanding the facts, they realize That the Dharma is like a boat; When the notion that receiving teaching is paramount has been relinquished, It is referred to as “understanding the Dharma.” [XIV.2]
so so skye bo'i shes pa yis/ / de bzhin du ni gnyis rtogs nas/ / shes pa de yongs rdzogs bya'i phyir/ / mthun pa'i chos ni rab tu sgrub/ /
With an ordinary being’s knowledge The two are understood accordingly. In order to complete the knowledge, They thoroughly practice the Dharma through attunement. [XIV.3]
de nas des ni sa dang por/ / byang chub sems dpa' de bdag nyid/ / kun dang mnyam par 'jig rten las/ / 'das pa'i ye shes bla med 'thob/ /
Next, upon the first ground The bodhisattva, being of the nature of that And equal to all, attains the unsurpassable Wakefulness beyond the world. [XIV.4]
mthong bas spang bya'i nyon mongs rnams/ / thams cad yang dag zad byas nas/ / shes bya'i sgrib pa spang ba'i phyir/ / bsgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor/ /
Having genuinely exhausted all afflictions That are to be eliminated through seeing, They, in order to eliminate cognitive obscuration, Thoroughly apply themselves to meditation. [XIV.5]
rnam 'jog rnam par mi rtog pa'i/ / ye shes lhan cig spyod pa yis/ / de bzhin sa ni lhag ma la/ / mthun pa yi ni chos spyod do/ /
By practicing the combination Of classifying and nonconceptual wakefulness, They likewise practice the concordant Dharma On the remaining grounds. [XIV.6]
blo ldan gang du sgrub pa'i yul/ / legs par rnyed dang gnas bzang dang / / sa bzang ba dang grogs bzang dang / / rnal 'byor bde ba'i yon tan ldan/ /
The place of practice of the wise Is well equipped, a good dwelling, A good ground with good company, and it is endowed With qualities that delight a spiritual practitioner. [XIV.7]
byang chub sems dpa' thos mang dang / / bden mthong smra mkhas brtse ba can/ / skyo med skyes bu dam pa ni/ / chen po yin par shes par bya/ /
The bodhisattva whose learning is great, Who sees the truth, is skilled in teaching, Possesses love, and is not weary, Is to be known as a great holy being. [XIV.8]
dmigs pa bzang dang ston pa bzang / / thabs bzang ba dang nges 'byung dang / / sbyor ba bzang po'i bdag nyid kyi/ / yang dag gtod pa yin par bshad/ /
Excellent focus, excellent adherence, Excellent means, definitive emergence, And excellent application— This explains the nature of genuine commitment. [XIV.9]
dga' dang dal bar skye ba dang / / nad med pa dang ting nge 'dzin/ / rnam par 'byed pa'i byed rgyu ni/ / sngon chad bsod nams byas pa nyid/ /
Joy, being born with leisure, Freedom from disease, meditative absorption, and discernment— The cause of these Is the production of merit in the past. [XIV.10]
chos kyi dbyings ni ma gtogs pa/ / gang phyir chos med de yi phyir/ / sangs rgyas rnams kyis de dag las/ / nges 'byung chags sogs yin par dgongs/ /
Apart from the basic field of phenomena, There are no phenomena. The buddhas have therefore realized that deliverance Is attachment and the rest. [XIV.11]
chos kyi dbyings ni ma gtogs par/ / gang phyir chos med de yi phyir/ / kun nas nyon mongs bstan pa la/ / blo ldan dgongs pa de yin 'dod/ /
Apart from the basic field of phenomena, There are no phenomena. Thus, the wise hold this to be the intent Of the teaching on thorough affliction. [XIV.12]
gang phyir chags sogs de nyid la/ / tshul bzhin 'jug pa de yi phyir/ / de las rnam grol 'gyur des na/ / de yis de dag las nges 'byung / /
Because attachment and the like Are themselves engaged correctly, A complete liberation from them occurs— And through that one definitively emerges from them. [XIV.13]

sems can ched du dmyal ba'i srid par gnas pa yi/ / sdug bsngal mi bzad cis kyang rgyal sras gnod byed min/ / zhi srid yon tan skyon gyis theg pa dman zhugs pa'i/ / rnam rtog dge ba sna tshogs blo ldan gnod byed yin/ /

Excruciating pains of life in hell for the sake of sentient beings Do not in any way harm the child of the victorious ones. Yet the various virtuous thoughts that condition the inferior vehicle, holding peace and existence to be good and bad— These are harmful for the wise. [XIV.14]

blo dang ldan pa dmyal bar gnas pa dus kun du/ / byang chub dri med yangs pa'i bar du gcod byed min/ / theg pa gzhan la rab bsil rnam rtog bdag phan pa/ / rab tu bde bar gnas kyang bar du gcod par byed/ /

For the wise, remaining in hell can never Obstruct the stainless wide awakening. With the thoroughly cooling thoughts that benefit oneself in other vehicles, One may be thoroughly at ease; yet there is that obstruction. [XIV.15]
chos med pa dang dmigs pa dang / / kun nas nyon mongs med rnam dag / sgyu ma la sogs 'dra ba dang / / de bzhin nam mkha' 'drar shes bya/ /
No phenomena and yet observation, No thorough affliction and yet purification— These should be known to be comparable To such things as illusions and space. [XIV.16]
ji ltar tshul bzhin bris pa'i ri mo la/ / mtho dman med kyang snang ba de bzhin du/ / yang dag ma yin rtog la rnam kun du/ / gnyis po rtag tu med kyang snang bar 'gyur/ /
In a well-made painting, there is no high and low, And yet there seems to be. Likewise, while the false imagination never contains the two, It seems that they are there. [XIV.17]
ji ltar chu rnyog pa las dang ba ni/ / dang ba nyid de de las skyes min gyi/ / de ni de la dri ma bral bar zad/ / de bzhin rang sems dag la tshul de nyid/ /
When murky water clears up, Clarity is not produced from that; Rather, it is simply free from impurities. That is also exactly how it is with the purity of one’s own mind. [XIV.18]
sems ni rtag tu rang bzhin 'od gsal 'dod/ / de ni glo bur nyes pas ma rungs byas/ / chos nyid sems las gzhan pa'i sems gzhan ni/ / 'od gsal ma yin rang bzhin la brjod do/ /

The mind is held to be constantly luminous; It is rendered unfit by the adventitious flaws. Any mind other than the mind of the intrinsic nature Is not luminous—the reference is to the natural. [XIV.19]
byang chub sems dpa' sems can la/ / bu gcig pa la bya ba bzhin/ / rkang gi khong nas byams pa che/ / de ltas rtag phan byed par 'dod/ /
Bodhisattvas treat all sentient beings As if they were their only child. Feeling great love from the marrow of their bones, They always wish to help them. [XIV.20]
sems can rnams la phan byed phyir/ / de la chags skyes ltung mi 'gyur/ / 'di yi zhe sdang rnam kun du/ / sems can kun dang 'gal bar 'gyur/ /
As they benefit sentient beings, They may be attached but incur no downfall. It is hatred that is always Opposed to all sentient beings. [XIV.21]
ji ltar phug ron rang gi bu mchog byams/ / rang gi bu de nye bar 'khyud nas 'dug / de 'dra ba la khong khro 'gal ba ltar/ / brtser bcas lus can bu la'ang de dang 'dra/ /
The pigeon, with unparalleled love, Lies embracing its young ones; Just as hatred is precluded there, so it is With the loving ones and their children, embodied beings. [XIV.22]
gang phyir byams pa de phyir khong khro 'gal/ / gang phyir zhi ba de phyir gnod sems 'gal/ / gang phyir don byed de phyir sgyu sems 'gal/ / gang phyir sim byed de phyir 'jigs byed 'gal/ /
sman bzang po la nad pa bzhin/ / 'khor ba la ni 'jug par byed/ / nad pa la ni sman pa bzhin/ / sems can rnams la sgrub par byed/ /
As with the sick and excellent medicine, They enter cyclic existence. As with the doctor and the sick, They practice for sentient beings. [XIV.24]
bran ma grub pa ji bzhin du/ / bdag nyid la ni sgrub par byed/ / zong la tshong ba ji bzhin du/ / 'dod pa dag la sgrub par byed/ /
As with a servant that is useless, They practice on themselves. Like merchants with their merchandise They practice for those who desire. [XIV.25]
gos la btso blag mkhan bzhin du/ / las la rab tu sgrub par byed/ / bu gzhon pa la pha bzhin du/ / sems can mi 'tsho sgrub par byed/ /
Like dyers with their fabric, They practice the activities. As with a father and his young son, They practice without hurting sentient beings. [XIV.26]
me don gnyer la gtsub shing ltar/ / rtag par rab tu sgrub par byed/ / yid brtan bzhin du lhag pa'i sems/ / ma rdzogs pa la sgrub par byed/ /
Like a man in pursuit of fire and his sticks, They are engaged in constant practice. Like a trustworthy person, they continue With superior intent the practice to perfection. [XIV.27]
sgyu ma mkhan ltar shes bya la/ / shes rab kyis ni sgrub par byed/ / de ni byang chub sems dpa' yi/ / ji ltar gong du sgrub par 'dod/ /
Like a magician, they practice With insight into the objects of cognition. This is held to be the way and the occasions Of the bodhisattva’s practice. [XIV.28]
de ltar rtag tu brtson 'grus rgya chen ldan/ / gnyis yongs smin par bya la rab brtson de/ / rim gyis dri med mi rtog blo mchog gis/ / sgrub pa bla na med par rab tu 'gro/ /

Thus, always and with great diligence, They pursue the twofold maturation. Gradually, by means of the supreme intelligence, stainless and without concept, They proceed to the unsurpassable practice. [XIV.29]
theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan las/ sgrub pa'i le'u ste bcu bzhi pa'o// //
This was the fourteenth chapter of the Ornament of the Great Vehicle Sūtras, the chapter on practice.

d.crumb: 15. gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa

f.d: 15. [gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa'i le'u]
15. Practical Instructions and Advice
bskal pa grangs med nges 'byung zhing / / mos pa rnam par 'phel byed pa/ / ji ltar chu yis rgya mtsho bzhin/ / dge chos rnams kyis yang dag rdzogs/ /
With deliverance over an incalculable eon, And the increase of devotion, The qualities of virtue are perfected, Like rivers flowing into the sea. [XV.1]
de bzhin du ni tshogs bsags pa'i/ / rgyal sras gzod nas dag pa po/ / legs par shes shing sems dge ba/ / bsgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor/ /
Thus, having gathered the accumulations, The children of the victorious ones are already purified. With clear knowledge and virtuous minds, They fully commit themselves to meditation. [XV.2]
de tshe chos kyi rgyun la ni/ / sangs rgyas rnams las zhi gnas dang / / ye shes yangs pa thob bya'i phyir/ / gdams ngag rgya chen rnyed par 'gyur/ /
At that time, within the stream of Dharma, They receive from the buddhas Vast practical instructions for the attainment Of calm abiding and expansive wakefulness. [XV.3]
de nas dang por sdom brtson de/ / mdo yi sde la sogs pa'i chos/ / mi gnyis don ni rnam 'byed pa/ / mdo sogs ming la sems 'jog go/ /
Initially, the one who persists in the vows Relates to the Dharma of the sūtras and so forth That explore the nondual meaning, By placing the mind on the names of these sūtras and so forth. [XV.4]
de nas de ni rim bzhin du/ / tshig rab dbye la dpyod byed cing / / so so'i nang la tshul bzhin du/ / de yi don yang rnam par dpyod/ /
From there on, they gradually Distinguish the categories of the words And within each Determine the meanings correctly. [XV.5]
don de dag ni nges bzung nas/ / chos la kun nas sdom par byed/ / de yi don ni thob bya'i phyir/ / de nas de ni smon par byed/ /
Once the meanings have been ascertained, The Dharma is thoroughly summarized. For the sake of achieving the objectives, Subsequently, there is aspiration toward them. [XV.6]
yid kyi brjod pas rgyun chags su/ / btsal bya so sor brtag par bya/ / yid la byed pa brjod med par/ / ro gcig pas kyang dpyad par bya/ /
With the expressions of the mind, It is continuously sought for and examined. While the mind is directed without expression, It should nevertheless examine through one taste. [XV.7]
chos kyi ming ni bsdoms pa'ang 'di/ / zhi gnas lam du shes par bya/ / lhag mthong lam ni de'i don rnams/ / rnam par dpyod par shes par bya/ /
The summary of names of the Dharma Should be known to be the path of calm abiding. The path of special insight should be known To be an examination of the meaning. [XV.8]
zung du 'brel ba'i lam ni de/ / bsdoms pa yin par shes par bya/ / zhum pa'i sems ni rab gzung ste/ / rgod pa yang ni zhi bar bya/ /
The path of unity should be known To be the integration. The dull mind is seized And agitation pacified. [XV.9]
de nas dmigs pa de la ni/ / mnyam par gyur na btang snyoms gzhag / de la rtag tu bya ba dang / / gus par bya ste sbyar bar bya/ /
Thus, when there is balance with that focus, One rests in equanimity. This should be approached Through constant and devoted application. [XV.10]
dmigs pa la ni sems gtad nas/ / de'i rgyun rnam par g.yeng mi bya/ / rnam g.yeng myur du rtogs byas nas/ / de la slar ni blan par bya/ /
Having directed the mind to the focus, The mind is not distracted from the continuum, Distraction is realized quickly, And the mind is summoned once more. [XV.11]
blo ldan gong nas gong du yang / / sems ni nang du bsdu bar bya/ / de nas yon tan mthong ba'i phyir/ / ting nge 'dzin la sems gdul lo/ /
The wise individual increasingly Gathers the mind within. As the qualities are seen, The mind is tamed within meditative absorption. [XV.12]
rnam g.yeng nyes pa mthong ba'i phyir/ / de la mi dga' zhi bar bya/ / brnab sems yid mi bde la sogs/ / langs pa de bzhin zhi bar bya/ /
As the defects of distraction are seen, Lack of joy is pacified. The occurrence of covetousness, mental discomfort, and so forth, Is likewise pacified. [XV.13]
de nas sdom brtson can gyis ni/ / sems la mngon par 'du byed bcas/ / rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba 'thob/ / de goms pa las 'du mi byed/ /
The one who persists in the vows Applies the mind, And attainment occurs naturally. Through familiarization with that, there will be no formation. [XV.14]
de nas de yis lus dang sems/ / shin tu sbyangs pa che thob nas/ / yid la byed dang bcas shes bya/ / de yis de ni 'phel byas nas/ /
When body and mind Have thereby attained great agility, This should be known to involve directing the mind. When that is then enhanced, [XV.15]
'phel ba ring du 'gro ba yis/ / dngos gzhi'i gnas pa des 'thob bo/ / mngon shes don du gnyer bas de/ / sbyangs nas las su rung ba'i mchog /
The development reaches far And so there will be abidance in the main part. The pursuit of superknowledges Brings training and supreme pliability. [XV.16]
bsam gtan las 'thob mngon par shes/ / mngon par bsgrubs pa'i sgo nas de/ / sangs rgyas dpag tu med pa la/ / mchod pa'i phyir dang mnyan pa'i phyir/ / 'jig rten khams ni rnams su 'gro/ /
As the superknowledges achieved through concentration Become fully accomplished, There is, for the sake of venerating and receiving Innumerable buddhas, A journey throughout the world realms. [XV.17]
'dis ni sangs rgyas dpag med la/ / bskal dpag med par bsnyen bkur byas/ / de la bsnyen bkur byas pa'i phyir/ / sems ni las rung mchog tu 'gyur/ /
Having served and worshipped Innumerable buddhas for innumerable eons, The result of service and worship Is the supreme pliability of the mind. [XV.18]
des na de dag sngon rol du/ / phan yon lnga ni 'thob 'gyur te/ / des ni rnam par dag pa'i snod/ / bla na med pa nyid 'gyur 'di'i/ /
Then, in the prelude to purity Five benefits are attained, And with that, one becomes An unexcelled pure vessel. [XV.19]
lus la gnas ngan len pa kun/ / skad cig re re la zad 'gyur/ / lus dang sems ni kun du yang / / shin tu sbyangs pas gang bar 'gyur/ /
The negative tendencies of the body Are with each instant brought to exhaustion. Body and mind are at all times Replenished by means of agility. [XV.20]
chos rnams snang ba thams cad du/ / yongs su chad pa med rtogs 'gyur/ / yang dag pa yi rgyu mtshan ni/ / ma brtags pa dag rab tu mthong / /
The light of the Dharma is always Realized without interruption. Unimagined marks of the genuine Are fully perceived. [XV.21]
de bzhin chos sku rab rdzogs dang / / rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir/ / blo dang ldan pa rnam kun du/ / rtag tu rgyu yongs 'dzin par byed/ /
In this way, to perfect the body of qualities, And for the sake of purification, The wise do in all regards Always embrace the causes. [XV.22]
de nas de 'drar gyur pa yi/ / byang chub sems dpa' mnyam gzhag pas/ / yid kyi brjod pa ma gtogs par/ / don kun rab tu mi mthong ngo / /
As a bodhisattva of this kind Rests in equipoise, There is no perception of objects Aside from the expressions of the mind. [XV.23]
chos kyi snang ba 'phel bya'i phyir/ / brtson 'grus brtan pa kun du brtsam/ / chos kyi snang ba 'phel nas ni/ / sems tsam la ni gnas par 'gyur/ /
To increase the light of Dharma, The steadfast one musters diligence in all regards. As the light of Dharma increases, One abides in mind only. [XV.24]
de nas don du snang ba kun/ / sems su rab tu snang bar 'gyur/ / de tshe de yi gzung ba yi/ / rnam par g.yeng ba de spangs 'gyur/ /
Since all appearances of objects Clearly manifest as the mind, This is the time of the relinquishment Of the distraction of the apprehended. [XV.25]
de nas de la 'dzin pa yi/ / rnam par g.yeng ba 'ba' zhig lus/ / de tshe bar chad med pa yi/ / ting nge 'dzin la myur du reg /
Then only the distraction Of an apprehender remains. At this point, the unimpeded meditative absorption Will be reached quickly [XV.26]
'di ltar de yi mjug thogs su/ / 'dzin pa'i rnam par g.yeng ba spong / / 'di dag [{]go rims [,]go rim [}]bzhin du ni/ / dro bar 'gyur sogs yin shes bya/ /
For the relinquishment of the apprehender Follows in the wake of it. These should be understood to be, Respectively, heat and so forth. [XV.27]
de nas des ni 'jig rten las/ / 'das pa'i ye shes bla med pa/ / rnam par mi rtog dri ma med/ / 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba 'thob/ /
Then, beyond the world, They attain the unsurpassable wakefulness— Nonconceptual, stainless, And free from dualistic grasp. [XV.28]
de 'di'i gnas yongs gyur pa ste/ / sa ni dang po yin par 'dod/ / de 'di bskal pa dpag med kyis/ / shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur/ /
This is their fundamental transformation And so this is held to be the first ground; Following an unfathomable eon, This is utter purity. [XV.29]
chos kyi dbyings ni mnyam pa nyid/ / rab tu rtogs nas de yi tshe/ / rtag tu sems can thams cad la/ / bdag dang mtshungs pa'i sems 'thob ste/ /
As the basic field of phenomena Is here clearly realized to be equality, There constantly occurs toward all beings An understanding that they are the same as oneself. [XV.30]
sems can rnams la bdag med dang / / sdug bsngal dang ni don bya dang / / lan la mi re 'di sems snyoms/ / rgyal sras gzhan dang 'dra ba yin/ /

With respect to all sentient beings, The perception is equal in terms of absence of self, Suffering, objective, and nonexpectation of reward. Moreover, one is like the other children of the victorious ones. [XV.31]
des ni khams gsum 'dus byas rnams/ / yang dag ma yin kun rtog par/ / ye shes shin tu rnam dag pa/ / gnyis su med pa'i don gyis mthong / /
All conditioned phenomena within the three realms Are the false imagination— This they see by means of the nondual nature Of utterly pure wakefulness. [XV.32]
de dag med pa'i ngo bo nyid/ / mthong bas spang bya rnams las grol/ / des na de tshe mthong ba'i lam/ / thob pa zhes ni nges par brjod/ /
Seeing the very essence of that which is devoid of the two, They have become free of the discards. Hence, they are definitively said To have “achieved the path of seeing.” [XV.33]
med pa'i stong pa nyid shes shing / / de bzhin yod pa'i stong nyid dang / / rang bzhin stong pa nyid shes pas/ / stong pa shes pa zhes brjod do/ /
Knowing the emptiness of the nonexistent As well as the emptiness of the existent, And the natural emptiness, They are said to be “knowers of emptiness.” [XV.34]
mtshan med bzhi ni rnam rtog rnams/ / yang dag zad pa yin zhes bya/ / smon pa med par gyur pa'i de/ / yang dag ma yin kun rtog go/ /
The ground for the absence of marks Is taught to be the genuine exhaustion of thoughts. For the absence of wishes, It is the false imagination. [XV.35]
rgyal sras byang chub phyogs mthun pa/ / rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad ni/ / rtag tu mthong ba'i lam de dang / / lhan cig tu ni thob par 'dod/ /
It is held that, for the child of the victorious ones, All of the different factors that accord with enlightenment Are always attained together With this path of seeing. [X.36]
gang zhig blo yis 'gro ba 'dus byas tsam/ / bdag med sdug bsngal rgyas pa tsam shes te/ / don med rang bzhin bdag lta rnam spangs nas/ / bdag nyid che lta don chen rnyed pa gang / /

The one whose mind realizes that wandering beings Are merely conditioned phenomena, the selfless unfolding of suffering, Gives up the meaningless view of self And discovers the deeply meaningful view of the great. [XV.37]
'di ni bdag lta med par bdag tu lta/ / sdug bsngal med par shin tu sdug bsngal 'gyur/ / rang la phan byas bdag la ji lta bar/ / don kun byed la lan kyang re ba med/ /

Without any view of self, they regard selves, Without any suffering, they suffer intensely. As with one’s relation to oneself when benefiting oneself, They bring all benefits, but without the expectation of reward. [XV.38]
gang zhig grol ba mchog gis sems grol la/ / 'ching ba mi zad yun yang ring por bcings/ / sdug bsngal mthar thug pa ni ma mthong yang / / rab tu sbyor ba nyid dang byed pa nyid/ /
While their minds have been freed by supreme liberation, They are bound for a very long time due to endless ties. Although they see no end to suffering, They apply themselves and act. [XV.39]
'jig rten tshe gcig rang sdug bkur mi nus/ / 'jig rten gnas pa srid du gzhan sdug bsngal/ / bsdoms pa smos ci dgos te bsam du med/ / byang chub sems dpa' de las bzlog pa yin/ /

Worldly persons cannot bear their own suffering for one lifetime; Why even mention the combined suffering of others For as long as the world exists—that is unthinkable. With the bodhisattvas, the case is entirely different. [XV.40]
rgyal sras sems can rnams la dga' ba dang / / byams pa gang yin sbyor dang mi skyo gang / / de ni srid pa dag na ngo mtshar che/ / sems can bdag dang mtshungs phyir de lta'ang min/ /

With joy and love for sentient beings, The children of the victorious ones are tirelessly active— This is a great wonder within the worlds of existence. Yet, since sentient beings are the same as themselves, it is also no wonder. [XV.41]
de nas de ni lhag ma yi/ / sa rnams bsgom pa'i lam 'di la/ / ye shes rnam pa gnyis po dag / bsgom phyir rab tu sbyong bar byed/ /
From there on, upon the remaining grounds, The path of cultivation, They practice for the sake Of cultivating the twofold wakefulness. [XV.42]
rnam par mi rtog ye shes de/ / sangs rgyas chos ni sbyong bar byed/ / gzhan ni ji bzhin rnam 'jog pa/ / sems can rnams ni yongs smin byed/ /
Nonconceptual wakefulness Perfects the qualities of buddhahood, While the other, describing in complete accordance, Ripens sentient beings. [XV.43]
grangs med gnyis ni rdzogs pa yis/ / bsgom pa yi ni tshar phyin te/ / bsgom pa tha ma thob nas ni/ / byang chub sems dpa' dbang bskur ba/ /
At the end of two incalculable eons, Cultivation comes to perfection. Having reached the end of cultivation, The bodhisattva is empowered. [XV.44]
rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin/ / rtog pas mi shigs thob nas ni/ / gnas gzhan gyur pas mthar thug pa/ / sgrib pa kun gyi dri med pa/ /
With the attainment of the vajra-like meditative absorption, Indestructible to thought, Comes the final, fundamental transformation In the absence of the stains of obscuration. [XV.45]
gang la gnas nas sems can kun/ / phan phyir rab tu sgrub byed pa/ / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa yi/ / go 'phang bla na med pa 'thob/ /
Abiding in that which is active For the benefit of all sentient beings, They gain the omniscient wakefulness Of the unsurpassable stage. [XV.46]
de ltar mthong dka'i thub pa rtag mthong ba/ / thos pa mnyam med las byung rab dang ba'i/ / shugs kyis rtag par shin tu sems tshim la/ / ji lta bur na don chen 'gyur ma yin/ /

Thus, constantly beholding the able ones, so difficult to behold, And always satiated with the buoyant brightness, That arises by the power of peerless learning, How could they not attain the great objective? [XV.47]
chos kyi sgo la rnam par gnas pa la/ / de bzhin gshegs rtag mngon sum 'doms mdzad cing / / co nas 'dren bzhin nyes pa'i tshang tshing nas/ / mtshan gyis drangs te byang chub la dgod do/ /

To those abiding in the gateway of Dharma, The thus-gone ones always grant direct instruction. As if pulled by their hair, they are powerfully delivered Out of the wilderness of error and established in enlightenment. [XV.48]

sangs rgyas rnams ni rtag tu rang don yang dag sbyor la legs par bsngags pa dang / / log par sbyor la smod mdzad gnas dang rnam 'byed lhur len mchog gi sems can la/ / gang zhig spangs dang bsten pas bde gshegs bstan pa 'di la rnal 'byor yangs 'gyur ba/ / bar chad mthun pa'i chos ni rnam pa thams cad rgyal rnams tshul bzhin 'di na ston/ /

The buddhas always duly praise authentic engagement toward one’s own objective, whereas they spurn flawed practices. For sentient beings who perfectly pursue abidance and discernment, They show what is to be abandoned and relied on in this teaching of the Bliss-Gone One. What the obstacles and the aids to this vast spiritual training are—this the victorious ones will always correctly reveal. [XV.49]
de ni mthong ba rab dag mi rtog byang chub kyis/ / 'jig rten thams cad zil mnan mun pa chen po yang / / rnam pa kun tu bsal nas nyi ma chen po dag / shar ba bzhin du 'gro ba rnams la lam me'o/ /

With perfectly pure vision, enlightenment beyond thought, They outshine the entire world. Illuminating in every way even the greatest darkness, To wandering beings they are like the rising, brilliant sun. [XV.50]

de ltar rtag tu dge ba bsags pas rab gang zhing / / thub pa las ni rtag tu gdams ngag che thob pa'i/ / sems dpa' mchog ni sems kyi ting 'dzin rab yangs pa/ / thob nas yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol 'gro bar 'gyur/ /

Thus, constantly replenished by the virtuous accumulations, The supreme being who constantly obtains magnificent practical instructions from the able ones Will attain the truly vast mind of meditative absorption And proceed to the far side of the ocean of excellent qualities. [XV.51]
theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan las/ gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa'i le'u ste bco lnga pa'o// //
This was the fifteenth chapter of the Ornament of the Great Vehicle Sūtras, the chapter on the practical instructions and advice.
16. [thabs dang ldan pa'i las kyi le'u]
16. Summary of Chapters 11 through 15
sdom ni/ mos pa mang ba nyid dang ni/ / chos tshol ba dang bshad pa dang / / de bzhin sgrub dang yang dag pa'i/ / gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa yin/ /
The summary consists Of great inspiration, investigation of the Dharma, Teaching of the Dharma, practice, And the practical instructions and advice. [XVI.1]

ji ltar nags tshal dang ni lus can ri bo dang / / chu bo rnams kyi rten ni kun nas sa yin pa/ / de bzhin mkhas pa rnams kyi las rnam gsum po yang / / kun nas sbyin pa la sogs dge ba'i yin par brjod/ /

Forests, embodied beings, mountains, and rivers Are always supported by the ground; It is taught that, similarly, for the virtues of generosity and so forth The three actions of the wise are always the basis. [XVI.2]

shin tu dka' ba'i las ni ngo bo sna tshogs pa/ / bskal pa mang pos tshar phyin mngon brtson bdag nyid can/ / rgyal sras rnams ni lus dang ngag sems rang bzhin gyi/ / las rnams dag gis 'di na yid 'byung 'gyur ba med/ /

As they exert themselves in extremely difficult tasks That are of diverse character and take many eons to complete, The children of the victorious ones do not get discouraged from action, Which is of the nature of body, speech, and mind. [XVI.3]

ji ltar bdag la phan 'dod dug dang mtshon dang ni/ / gnam lcags lce dang dgra las rang gi lus zlog pa/ / de bzhin rgyal sras theg pa dman pa rnam gnyis las/ / las rnam gsum gyi bdag nyid zlog par byed pa yin/ /

Those who wish themselves well guard their bodies From poison, weapons, lightning bolts, and enemies; The children of the victorious ones similarly turn their threefold acts Away from the two inferior vehicles. [XVI.4]

rtag tu rnam par mi rtog las can las min zhing / / las kyi bya ba dang rnam gsum la mi lta ste/ / des na 'di ni de'i thabs yang dag gzung ba'i phyir/ / las rnams dag pa mtha' yas de yi pha rol 'gro/ /
Always nonconceptual, they never conceive In terms of agent, object, and action. Therefore, as they embrace the authentic methods, Their perfectly pure acts are infinite and transcendent. [XVI.5]
theg pa chen po mdo sde'i rgyan las/ thabs dang ldan pa'i las kyi le'u ste bcu drug pa'o// //
This was the sixteenth chapter of the Ornament of the Great Vehicle Sūtras, the chapter on the possession of skillful means.

d.crumb: 17. pha rol tu phyin pa dang bsdu ba

f.d: 17. [pha rol tu phyin pa dang bsdu ba'i le'u]
17. Skillful Means
grangs dang de yi mtshan nyid go rims dang / / nges pa'i tshig dang yon tan goms bya dang / / de dag rab dbye bsdu dang mi mthun phyogs/ / yon tan phan tshun rnam nges yin zhes bya/ /
Their enumeration, characteristics, sequence, Etymologies, process of training, Analysis, summary, conflicting factors, Qualities, and mutual ascertainment—this is how they are known. [XVII.1]
longs spyod dang lus phun sum tshogs pa dang / / 'khor rtsom phun sum tshogs pa mngon mtho dang / / rtag tu nyon mongs dbang nyid mi 'gro dang / / bya ba rnams la phyin ci ma log pa'o/ /
Enjoyments, excellent body, Retinue, and excellent perseverance for the truly elevated. Never being under the control of the afflictions, And being unmistaken about the course of action. [XVII.2]
sems can don la rab brtson pa/ / gtong dang mi gnod bzod pas byed/ / gnas dang grol ba bzhir bcas pa/ / rang don rnam pa thams cad spyod/ /

Diligent pursuit of the welfare of others Is accomplished by giving, abstaining from harm, and patience. Abidance and liberation, along with their basis, Bring about all that is beneficial for oneself. [XVII.3]
mi 'phongs pa dang rnam par mi 'tshe dang / / rnam 'tshe bzod dang bya bas mi skyo dang / / dga' byed legs par brjod pa de yi phyir/ / gzhan gyi don ni rang gi don yin no/ /
No destitution, nonviolence, Tolerance of aggression, no weariness with activity, Engendering joy, and excellent speech— Thus the objectives of others are their own. [XVII.4]
longs spyod mngon par mi dga' dang / / rab gus gnyis la mi skya dang / / rnal 'byor rnam par mi rtog pa/ / theg chen mtha' dag 'dir zad do/ /
No fondness for pleasures, complete devotion, No weariness with respect to the two, Spiritual training, and nonconceptuality— The entire Great Vehicle comes down to just this. [XVII.5]
yul rnams la ni ma chags lam/ / de thob rnam g.yeng sdom pa'i gzhan/ / sems can mi gtong 'phel ba dang / / sgrib pa rnam par sbyong ba'i gzhan/ /
These are the path of nonattachment to objects, Avoiding the distraction of trying to obtain them, Not forsaking sentient beings, development, And the thorough purification of obscurations. [XVII.6]
bslab gsum dbang du mdzad nas ni/ / rgyal bas pha rol phyin pa drug / yang dag bshad de dang po gsum/ / tha ma gnyis kyis rnam pa gnyis/ / gcig ni gsum char la yang gtogs/ /
The Victorious One has taught the six transcendences With reference to the three trainings: The first three, the final two that make two, And the one that is included in all three. [XVII.7]
sbyin pa mi mthun phyogs nyams dang / / rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan/ / 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed/ / sems can rnam smin byed rnam gsum/ /
Generosity is the breakdown of the conflicting factor, Possession of nonconceptual wakefulness, Complete fulfillment of all wishes, And the threefold maturation of sentient beings. [XVII.8]
tshul khrims mi mthun phyogs nyams dang / / rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan/ / 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed/ / sems can rnam smin byed rnam gsum/ /
Discipline is the breakdown of the conflicting factor, Possession of nonconceptual wakefulness, Complete fulfillment of all wishes, And the threefold maturation of sentient beings. [XVII.9]
bzod pa mi mthun phyogs nyams dang / / rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan/ / 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed/ / sems can rnam smin byed rnam gsum/ /
Patience is the breakdown of the conflicting factor, Possession of nonconceptual wakefulness, Complete fulfillment of all wishes, And the threefold maturation of sentient beings. [XVII.10]
brtson 'grus mi mthun phyogs nyams dang / / rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan/ / 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed/ / sems can rnam smin byed rnam gsum/ /
Diligence is the breakdown of the conflicting factor, Possession of nonconceptual wakefulness, Complete fulfillment of all wishes, And the threefold maturation of sentient beings. [XVII.11]
bsam gtan mi mthun phyogs nyams dang / / rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan/ / 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed/ / sems can rnam smin byed rnam gsum/ /
Concentration is the breakdown of the conflicting factor, Possession of nonconceptual wakefulness, Complete fulfillment of all wishes, And the threefold maturation of sentient beings. [XVII.12]
shes rab mi mthun phyogs nyams dang / / rnam par mi rtog ye shes ldan/ / 'dod pa thams cad yongs rdzogs byed/ / sems can rnam smin byed rnam gsum/ /
Insight is the breakdown of the conflicting factor, Possession of nonconceptual wakefulness, Complete fulfillment of all wishes, And the threefold maturation of sentient beings. [XVII.13]
snga ma la brten phyi ma skye/ / dman dang mchog tu gnas phyir dang / / rags pa dang ni phra ba'i phyir/ / de dag rim par bstan pa yin/ /
The subsequent ones arise based on the previous ones, They go from inferior to supreme, And from the coarse to the subtle; This is the reason for their sequence. [XVII.14]
dbul ba 'dor bar byed pa dang / / bsil ba 'thob dang khro bzod dang / / mchog sbyor ba dang yid 'dzin dang / / don dam shes pa'i phyir bshad do/ /
They are taught to be the eradication of poverty, Attaining coolness, exhaustion of anger, Joining with the supreme, seizing the mind, And knowledge of the ultimate. [XVII.15]
thams cad bsgom pa dngos po dang / / de bzhin yid la byed pa dang / / bsam pa dang ni thabs dag dang / / dbang sbyor nyid la rten par brjod/ /
All of the training is taught To be based on entities, Directing the mind, intent, Skillful means, and mastery. [XVII.16]
don rnams gtong bar byed pa dang / / rtsa ba sems pa la brten dang / / lus dang longs spyod phun tshogs dang / / gnyis rjes 'dzin dang rdzogs byed dang / /
Giving things Based on the intent associated with the fundamentals Brings about an excellent body and enjoyments, Providing for both, as well as completion; [XVII.17]
de yang ser sna med ldan par/ / chos dang zang zing mi 'jigs gtong / / sbyin pa de 'drar yongs shes nas/ / mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed/ /
A possession of those who are not stingy, It is the granting of Dharma, material things, and freedom from fears. Fully comprehending such generosity, The wise practice it authentically. [XVII.18]
yan lag drug zhi bsam pas zin/ / bde 'gro gnas pa sbyin byed dang / / rten dang zhi dang 'jigs pa med/ / bsod nams tshogs dang ldan pa dang / /

With six aspects and the embrace of the intent on peace, It brings happy states and the attainment of stability. Support, peace, and absence of fear— It is the possession of the accumulation of merit, [XVII.19]
brdar brtags chos nyid thob pa ste/ / sdom la gnas pa rnams la yod/ / tshul khrims de 'drar yongs shes nas/ / mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed/ /
Attained through the use of symbols and by the intrinsic nature, And thus present in those who possess the vows— Fully comprehending such discipline, The wise practice it authentically. [XVII.20]
mi mjed ji mi snyam shes dang / / snying rjes chos la rten pa'i phyir/ / phan yon lngar ni yang dag bshad/ / de ni gnyis kyi don byed de/ /
Tolerance, disregard, and knowledge— It is caused by compassion and reliance on the Dharma. Explained in terms of five benefits, It accomplishes the objectives of both. [XVII.21]
dka' thub gtso dang kun tu ldan/ / de la de ni rnam gsum 'dod/ / bzod pa de 'drar yongs shes nas/ / mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed/ /
Always in possession of the foremost austerity, It is asserted to be of three types. Fully comprehending such patience, The wise practice it authentically. [XVII.22]
dge la yang dag spro ba dang / / dad dang 'dun la rten pa dang / / dran sogs yon tan 'phel byed dang / / kun nas nyon mongs gnyen po dang / /
Genuinely delighting in virtue Is based on faith and aspiration. It brings the development of the qualities of mindfulness and so forth, Remedies thorough affliction, [XVII.23]
ma chags la sogs yon tan ldan/ / de dag la ni de rnam bdun/ / brtson 'grus de 'drar yongs shes nas/ / mkhas pa yang dag sgrub par byed/ /
And is in possession of the qualities of nonattachment and so forth. It is of seven types. Fully comprehending such diligence, The wise practice it authentically. [XVII.24]
sems ni nang du gnas pa dang / / dran dang brtson 'grus la brten pa/ / bde ba skyed par byed pa dang / / mngon shes gnas la dbang bsgyur ba/ /
It is mind resting within, Based on mindfulness and diligence. It creates delight, And involves mastery of superknowledges and abodes. [XVII.25]
